intro: Limodorum longicorne, commonly known as the long-beaked lily, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the forests of eastern Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, with broad, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a basal rosette. Limodorum longicorne thrives in shady, moist environments and is often found in woodlands and undergrowth. Its unique floral structure and ornamental value make it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
